result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick A. McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 9 months county jail with huber IMPOSED & STAYED;

2 years probation concurrent with 14CF197; conditions of probation 90 days county jail with huber credit for 14 days credit toward conditional jail time and underlying sentence, beginning 05-08-15 prior to 3:00 p.m.; restitution payable to Hayward Area Memorial Hospital in the amount of $10,957.00 joint/several.  If Hayward Area Memorial Hospital receives overpayment it is to be paid to John Butler.; No Contact with John Butler; any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; court costs in the amount of $443.00.  Bond money to be forwarded to Department of Corrections for restitution.

miscConds.notes: $10,957.00 plus surcharges; apply $500 bond   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  This is J & S with Michael Coupe.

Defendant Derrick A. McDaniel in court with attorney Nathan M Cockerham.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions to amend Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Battery 940.19(1); court grants motion to amend Ct. 1.  Advised of rights; joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts;  Defendant pleads NC to amended Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on amended Ct. 1; Sentence to 9 months Sawyer County Jail with huber 14 days credit IMPOSED & STAYED; 2 years probation concurrent with 14CF197; conditions of probation 90 days county jail with huber credit for 14 days credit toward conditional jail time and underlying sentence, beginning 05-08-15 prior to 3:00 p.m.; restitution payable to Hayward Area Memorial Hospital in the amount of $10,957.00 joint/several.  If Hayward Area Memorial Hospital receives overpayment it is to be paid to John Butler.; No Contact with John Butler; any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; court costs in the amount of $443.00.  Bond money to be forwarded to Department of Corrections for restitution.  Report to probation & parole today.  Advised of appeal rights; plea questionnaire filed.

served 327
Attorney James Jay Rennicke in court.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Start Forfeiture Proceedings  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Attorney James Jay Rennicke in court.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset for afternoon.  Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

State calls Officer Craig Faulstich---sworn/testifies.  Witness identifies DE.  State requests that the record reflect that witness has identified the DE-Court grants request.  Witness cross-examined.

State moves for bindover.  Attorney Rennicke makes argument re: outside incident, no proof of connection between anything Mr. McDaniel did anything that caused injury.  Testimony was that DE was involved directly in incident, thus court grants motion for bindover.  Probable cause found.

Attorney Rennicke moves to address bail---requests modification to a signature bond.  State requests bond remain in effect.  Court takes notice of 13CM99, where DE missed court after signing signature bond.  Court denies motion---bond stands.  Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.
